data.title: The New York Times
data.text:
APPLEBY—Dr. Aaron, on September 3, 1977, beloved husband of Doris, devoted father of Jean and Joseph, loving son of Lillian, brother of Joseph and Frederick. Service private. Three day shiva beginning Tuesday will be observed al the home of Frederick Appleby, 52 Dorchester Road, Scarsdale, N.Y.

BATTERMAN—John L., September 2, 1977, beloved husband of Margaret, father of Robert D. and John R. Batterman and Margaret Ann Homer, also survived by five grandchildren. Friends may call at The Fairchild Chapel, 220‐05 Hillside Ave, Queens Village, Monday and Tuesday, 2 to 5 and 7 to 9 P.M. Service at the First Presbyterian Church of Jamaica, Wednesday, 1:30 P.M. In lieu of flowers, donations to the Greater New York Y.M.C.A. and the American Cancer Fund would be appreciated.

BECKER—Dr. Leonard R., died July 17, 1977. Memorial service Wednesday, September 7, 1977, at 2 PM, In the main sanctuary, Central Synagogue, 55 St, on Lexington Ave.

BOYLE—Angela R., on September 3, 1977. Dear sister of Elizabeth Cronin and the late Margaret Boyle and Mary Graham. Dear aunt of Rev. Walter F. Graham, C.M. Reposing Leo F. Kearns Funeral Home, 443 Newbridge Ave, East Meadow, L.I. Mass of Christian Burial Tuesday 10:30 A.M. American Martyrs Church, Bayside. Interment Calvary Cemetery.

deKAY—Isabel Bruce, suddenly on September 3, 1977 at Deer Isle, Maine. Beloved wile of Captain Rodman deKay; mother of Juliet Baldwin Taylor, Willard A. Baldwin, Mary Ellen Nichols Fans, and Thomas W. S. Nichols. Sister of Alfred C. Bruce. Also survived by seven grandchildren and five great‐grandchildren. Services Wednesday 12 noon at St. John's Episcopal Church, Cold Spring Harbor, N.Y. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to The School Volunteer Program or Public Education Association, 20 West 40th St, N.Y., N.Y. 10018

DEVACK—Louis, beloved husband of Sally, devoted father of Jeffrey, and fatherin‐law of Barbara, dear brother of Irving and Bernard and adored grandfather of Karyn and Melissa. Services Tuesday, ?? A.M., ‘Parkside’ Chapels, Jerome Ave. near 170 St., Bronx.

DOSCHER—Alice B. In the 97th year of life. At the deceased's specific request no funeral services will be held. In lieu flowers, donations to the Horticultural Society of New York would be apprecialed.

GELLMAN—Meyer. On Sept 2, 1977, beloved husband of Laicha, father of Aviva and Isaiah, and grandfather of Paula and Judith. Funeral services Tuesday September 6, at 1:30 P.M. at ‘BoulevardPark West’ 115 W. 79 St.

GUENZBERG—Gertrude, beloved wife of the late Ralph, devoted mother of Muriel Weinstein and Dorothy Chandler, loving grandmother of Richard Weinslein, Joyce Charno, Nancy Chandler and Robert Chandler, beloved great grandmother of Ross and Lauren Churns and Jonathan Weinstein. Services Tuesday, 10:30 A.M., at ‘The Riverside,’ 1250 Central Ave., Far Rockaway, L.I.

ISAACS—Dr. Mervin. The officers and Board of Trustees note with profound sorrow the passing of Dr. Mervin Isaacs, longtime member of the Board and lireless worker for Shaaray Tefila of Far Rockaway

Waller S. Wurzburger, Rabbi Edward Berkowitz, Chairman of the Board Jerry Pressner, President

KALVIN—Joseph M., suddenly in his 87th year. Devoted and beloved brother of Nathan. Services Tuesday September 6 at 10:30 at ‘The Riverside’ 76th Street and Amsterdam Avenue. Please omit flowers.

KATZ—Mrs. Kate (Edelman). In Springfield, Massachusetts, on September 3 1977. 84 years old, of 197 Crestview Circle, Long Meadow, formerly of New York City. Widow of Alex Katz, beloved mother of Francine Hochman, of Long Meadow Mass., sister of Abe Edelman, of New York City. Also two grandchildren. Funeral Tuesday at 9 A.M. at the Harold R. Ascher & Son Memorial Chapel, 44 Sumner Avenue, Springfield Massachusetts. Interment service Tuesday at 1 PM at Mt. Judah Cemetery, Queens, New York.

KLIGMANN—Eugene, on September 3, beloved husband of Barbara, loving son of the late Benjamin and Sophie Kligmen, devoted father of Eugene, Jr., Marion Carol Albanese, Scott, Andrew and Jack Stewart. Services Frank E. Campbell, Madison Ave at 81 St, Tuesday, 1PM. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to Sloan‐Kettering Cancer Foundation.

KOPET—Samuel, beloved husband of Florence, devoted father of Scene Dundes and Howard. Dear brother of Estelle Schnell, Beatrice Yellen and Ida Welss, cherished grandfather. Services Tuesday, 10:30 A.M.,’ at Temple Beth Shalom, Broadway and Washington Ave., Lawrence, N.Y. No flowers.
